questions.question: Why might the HMM segment bull phases into shorter runs compared to bears?
options: Upside bursts increase variance/kurtosis, prompting the model to carve separate high-vol states
Bull markets always have lower returns
The model is biased toward bears
questions.explanation: Sudden positive jumps can produce distinct state statistics, splitting bulls into shorter regimes.

questions.question: If P(Bull→Bull)=0.79, what is the expected length (in days) of a bull run? Use E[length]=1/(1−p).
State one practical implication of volatility clustering for position sizing.
questions.answer_text: Increase caution/size reduction when entering during high-vol clusters; consider fractional Kelly.
